command.livemap.description: Command to manage the LiveMap mod.
livemap:no-data-to-display:
No data to display.

Is the mod disabled?
livemap:colormap-settings.hint:
Settings about block colors that the
client knows but the server doesn't.
livemap:colormap-generate.hint:
Generates a new Colormap of all the
blocks in the game (including modded
ones) and then sends it to the server.

Use this first if this is a fresh install
or when you change your mod list.
livemap:httpd-settings.hint:
Settings regarding the built-in httpd web server.
This is just a basic httpd web server, if you need/want
something better just disable this and run your own.
livemap:httpd-enabled.hint:
Enable the built-in http web server.
Disable this if you want to manually use a
standalone web server such as apache or nginx.
livemap:httpd-port.hint:
The port the built-in web server listens to. Make
sure the port is allocated if using a game web panel.
livemap:zoom-settings.hint:
Settings regarding the zoom aspect of the map.
The more zoom levels you have the more tile sets to
create which uses more drive space. So be cautious.
livemap:zoom.max-in.hint:
Extra zoom in layers will stretch the original
tile images so you can zoom in further without
the extra cost of rendering more tiles.
livemap:zoom.max-out.hint:
The maximum zoom out you can do on the map.
Each additional level requires a new set of tiles
to be rendered, so don't go too wild here.
livemap:zoom.default.hint:
The default zoom when loading the map in browser.
Normal sized tiles (1 pixel = 1 block) are always
at zoom level 0, making it a good default value.
livemap:lang.copy-alt: Copy this location to the clipboard
livemap:lang.paste-alt: Go to a point from the clipboard
livemap:lang.share-alt: Copy a sharable url to the clipboard
livemap:lang.center-alt: Center the map on this point
